problems.author: Doyoon Kim
problems.question: 5.60N of force is applied to a surface with an area of 61.0 \(\text{m}^2\) at an angle of \(67.6^{\circ}\) . Calculate the pressure. (\(0^{\circ}\) is perpendicular to the area.)

problems.author: Doyoon Kim
problems.question: Calculate the pressure at a depth of 3.13 m. The outside atmospheric pressure is 101325 Pa, the density of the fluid is 5.17 kg/L, and the gravitational constant is 9.81 \(\text{m/s}^2\).

problems.author: Doyoon Kim
problems.question: The external pressure applied to the fluid increases by 3.0 Pa. If the pressure at depth h was 3.5 Pa before the pressure increase, what is the pressure at that depth now?
problems.detailed: Since applied pressure is transmitted undiminished to all parts of the fluid, the answer is 3.5 Pa + 3.0 Pa = 6.5 Pa

problems.author: Doyoon Kim
problems.question: If you press M1 with force of F, what is the force created on the other side?
problems.hint: Pressure applied would be transmitted undiminished to all parts of the fluid.
problems.detailed:
If the created force is G,
\(\text{P} = \frac{\text{F}}{\text{A}_1} = \frac{\text{G}}{\text{A}_2}\)
\(\text{G} = \frac{\text{A}_2}{\text{A}_1} \text{F}\)

problems.author: Doyoon Kim
problems.question: Which of the following expressions is equal to \(\frac{A}_1 \text{M}_2 - \text{A}_2 \text{M}_1\)? d is the density of the fluid, \(\text{A}_1\) and \(\text{A}_2\) are the areas, and \(\text{M}_1\) and \(\text{M}_2\) are the masses.
problems.hint: External Pressure + Pressure by Mass + Pressure by Fluid Column is the same for both left and right, if the level is the same.
problems.detailed:
If the external pressure is P,
\(\text{P} + \frac{\text{M}_1 \text{g}}{\text{A}_1} + \text{dgh} = \text{P} + \frac{\text{M}_2 \text{g}}{\text{A}_2} + \text{dg} \times 0\)
\(\text{A}_1 \text{M}_2 - \text{A}_2 \text{M}_1 = \text{A}_1 \text{A}_2 \text{dh}\)
